alert.note: Alert for Sandusky; Wood (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 3:54PM EDT until June 08 at 12:40PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties. For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Portage River At Woodville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Water is encroaching on State Route 105 in Sandusky County northeast of U.S. 23. Water is in the backyard of residents on Bierley, Bridge, and Water Streets in Pemberville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.1 feet on 03/09/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EDT.
